content.description: A block on a level horizontal surface of negligible friction is initially traveling at 20 m/s to the left. A horizontal force <math> <semantics> <mover accent="true"> <mi>F</mi> <mo>→</mo> </mover> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=xfr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaaeaaaaaaaaa8qaceWGgbGbaSaaaaa@36F1@</annotation> </semantics> </math> is exerted to the right on the block for the time interval 0 < t < 0.10 s. The magnitude of the force is given as a function of time t by the equation F = αt , where α = 240 N/s and t is in seconds.
content.question: Which of the following free-body diagrams best shows the forces acting on the block at time t = 0.05 s ?

choices.label: The figure presents a dot with a force pointing to the right
The figure presents a dot with two forces. The first force is pointing to the right, and the second force is of greater magnitude and is pointing downward.
The figure presents a dot with two forces. The two forces are equal in magnitude and opposite in direction, pointing upward and downward respectively.

The figure presents a dot with four forces. The first pair of forces are equal in magnitude and opposite in direction, pointing upward and downward respectively. The second pair of forces are equal in magnitude and opposite in direction, pointing left and right respectively. The first pair of forces have greater magnitude than the second pair of forces.

The figure presents a dot with three forces. The first and second forces are equal in magnitude and opposite in direction, pointing upward and downward respectively. The third force has less magnitude than the first and second, and is pointing to the right.

content.answer: The figure presents a dot with three forces. The first and second forces are equal in magnitude and opposite in direction, pointing upward and downward respectively. The third force has less magnitude than the first and second, and is pointing to the right.
